name: Cymande
description: '''Cymande''' (<small>pronounced</small> {{IPAc-en|s|ɪ|ˈ|m|ɑː|n|d|eɪ}} {{respell|sih|MAHN|day}}) are a British [[funk]] group that was originally active in the early 1970s. The band name derives from a [[Calypso music|calypso]] word for "dove", which symbolises peace and love; "Dove" is also the title of one of their best-known songs. With a membership deriving from several Caribbean nations, Cymande were noted for an eclectic mix of [[funk]], [[Soul music|soul]], [[reggae]], [[Rock music|rock]], [[Music of Africa|African music]], [[Calypso music|calypso]], and [[jazz]] that they called "nyah-rock". The band formed in 1971 and released three albums before disbanding in 1974. After gaining newfound popularity when their music was sampled by many notable rap artists, Cymande reformed in the 2010s. Their most recent album ''Renascence'' was released in January 2025.
